abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education in Western Provinces
            Project aims to improve access to primary, and secondary
            education, which includes supply of textbooks, and teaching
            materials, particularly focused on minorities, to promote
            wider educational opportunities for them. This Indigenous
            peoples Plan (IPP) provides specific actions to be taken
            (Annex 1) during project implementation, Annex 2 identifies
            the statistics regarding minorities in the different project
            areas, while annex 3 outlines the ethnic minorities
            education strategy. The demand for child labor among ethnic
            minorities - largely living, and working in agriculture or
            herding - is very high, which conflicts with the costs of
            sending a child to school, thus accounting for late
            enrollments, absenteeism from school, and/or drop out cases.
            As well, educational attainment of the adult population, and
            its impact on minority family aspirations for the education
            of their children, demonstrate the high illiteracy rates,
            and susceptibility to cycles of poverty. Basic education
            will be expanded, consistent with the Ministry of
            Education's standard criteria for all schools, to
            include as well existing minority language textbooks, and
            identified supplementary reading materials at the Provincial
            level, prepared jointly with the Chinese Experts Panel.
            Special attention will be provided to girl's education,
            their enrollment, and school attendance, while distance
            education alternatives shall be provided for remote areas.
            The capacities of local departments of education will be
            strengthened to administer educational policies that include
            minority education strategies.
